title: Joan Collins, 86, steps out with husband Percy Gibson, 54, at the Attitude Awards
text:
They tied the knot in 2002 during a lavish wedding ceremony at Claridge's Hotel and are often seen out enjoying each other's company at a string of events in London.

And it was another night on the town for Dame Joan Collins, 86, and her husband Percy Gibson, 54, as they stepped out for the Virgin Atlantic Attitude Awards, held at London's Roundhouse on Wednesday night.

The legendary actress exuded classic elegance as she arrived at the glittering gala in a black floor-length gown with a thigh-high split and an embellished bolero jacket, ahead of receiving the Icon Award.

Out on the town: Joan Collins and her husband Percy Gibson attended the Virgin Atlantic Attitude Awards, held at London's Roundhouse on Wednesday night

Accessorising with a jewelled statement necklace, diamond earrings, and silver clutch bag, the former Dynasty star stood tall in a pair of black embellished heels.

Her devoted husband Percy, who cut a dapper figure in a grey suit, accompanied her into the Camden venue, where they rubbed shoulders with a host of stars, including Cheryl, Sam Smith, Taron Egerton, and Katherine Jenkins.

Just the night before, Joan and Percy were among the gusts at the Specsavers Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards.

Elegant: The legendary actress exuded classic elegance as she arrived at the glittering gala in a black floor-length gown with a thigh-high split and an embellished bolero jacket

Strike a pose: The former Dynasty star, 86, posed up a storm ahead of receiving the Icon Award

Chic: Accessorising with a jewelled statement necklace, diamond earrings, and silver clutch bag, the actress stood tall in a pair of black embellished heels

With the Attitude Awards in its eight year, 600 VIP guests dined while 13 awards celebrating the LGBTQ community were handed out, between live performances.

The event, sponsored by Virgin Atlantic and Jaguar, was presented by Ross Mathews, welcomed a host of celebrity guests with entertainment on the night including a roof-raising performance from Attitude’s 2019 Breakthrough Award winner Ava Max.

The star of Tina The Musical Tsemaye Bob-Egbe also performed the classic Proud Mary, while Katherine Jenkins sang her take on the Judy Garland classic Somewhere Over the Rainbow. Music Award recipient Mika closed the show.

Joan and Percy tied the knot in 2002 at Claridge's Hotel in London, the fifth time walking down the aisle for the star.

Mingle: Inside the event, she mingled with a host of VIP guests, including pop singer Cheryl

Golden girl: Cheryl also caught the eye, stepping out in a deeply plunging gold minidress

In May 2018, the legendary actress revealed her top tip for 'lasting marriage' to Hello! - saying that the reason it works is because they 'really support each other'.

She said: 'You won't always agree about everything, but you need to enjoy each other's company. Percy is such an amazing man, he is so kind and so caring.

'People get married on the crest of lust. Once that's gone, they look and think: 'What the hell? Who is this person?

'There has to be something else to fall back on. If there isn't, they start looking.'

Joan's acting career has spanned more than six decades with her most recent roles being in the hit TV series American Horror Story and Hawaii Five-0.

Snaps: Actor Taron Egerton was one of the many guests who flocked pose for a snap with Joan

All smiles: The screen star was all smiles as she sat beside Julian Clary at the glittering gala

It's a wrap: The star staved off the night chill with a chic black coat as she later exited the bash
